name: Teaching Guide: Exploring Women and the Blues

affiliation.name: New York City Department of Education/New York City School Library System

hasPart.name: Questions
hasPart.text:
1. Blues music appeared on the music scene in the 1920s. Using the items in the set, discuss how African American women influenced and helped shape the blues movement across the United States. How did blues music travel? 
2. Using the items in the set and additional resources, explore the cultural, social, and economic influences on blues music. Did the blues influence female and male singers differently? 
3. Using items in this set, discuss the origins of the blues and how it developed as a musical form. How can the blues be understood in terms of time? How did the blues’ place of origin influence the development of the music?

hasPart.name: Activity
hasPart.text: Blues music has a melancholy undertone; singers have been described as “having the blues.” Blues lyrics consist of three rhyming lines with the first line always repeated. Ask students to write their own three-line blues stanza, using items in the sets as models.
